column4: Financial assets safeguard society and the environment

To reach a sustainable future, every company must implement investment policies that continuously seek to improve the environmental, social and governance performance of any financial assets it owns, and any that it manages or controls on behalf of third-party asset owners.
A company should have policies and processes in place that enable them to screen their financial investments, so that negative impacts can be avoided or reduced over time.

This goal applies to companies that own financial assets, manage them as a service, or sell them to third-parties on behalf of managers. Financial assets include lenders of debt instruments, holders of equity shares in other companies, and fund investors.
